# Link

<DarkModeCompatible />

Navigation link for internal routes and external destinations. A versatile component for routing with multiple visual styles and safe external link handling.

## Overview

Use `Link` when you need…

- Navigation to internal pages or external URLs
- Visual variants via `variant`
- Color variants via `color`
- Button-like styling via `variant="button"` + `size`
- Safe external handling via `external` (adds `rel` + `target="_blank"`)

## Live Demo

<LiveDemo />

## Import

```tsx
import { Link } from '@grasdouble/lufa_design-system';
```

## Basic Usage

```tsx title="src/App.tsx"
import { Link } from '@grasdouble/lufa_design-system';

function App() {
  return (
    <>
      <Link href="/about">About</Link>
      <Link href="https://example.com" external>
        External Site
      </Link>
    </>
  );
}
```

## Anatomy

The Link component provides navigation with flexible styling:

```
┌─────────────────────────────────────┐
│  [startIcon]  Label  [endIcon] [↗]  │  ← Link Container
└─────────────────────────────────────┘
     ↑          ↑         ↑        ↑
     │          │         │        └─ Auto external indicator
     │          │         └────────── Optional trailing icon
     │          └────────────────────── Required text content
     └───────────────────────────────── Optional leading icon
```

**Component Structure:**

- **Container**: Native `<a>` element with styling variants
- **Start Icon** (optional): Leading icon positioned before the label
- **Label**: The main link text (required for accessibility)
- **End Icon** (optional): Trailing icon positioned after the label
- **External Indicator** (auto): Shows "↗" icon when `external={true}` and no `endIcon`

**Visual States:**

- Default: Underlined or styled based on variant
- Hover: Color change and visual feedback
- Focus: Keyboard navigation indicator (focus ring)
- Active: Pressed/clicking state
- Visited: Browser's visited link styling (can be styled)

## API Reference

### Props

| Prop        | Type                                                                          | Default     | Description             |
| ----------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ----------- | ----------------------- |
| `children`  | `ReactNode`                                                                   | -           | Link content            |
| `variant`   | `'default' \| 'underline' \| 'button'`                                        | `'default'` | Visual style variant    |
| `color`     | `'primary' \| 'secondary' \| 'success' \| 'warning' \| 'danger' \| 'inherit'` | `'primary'` | Color scheme            |
| `size`      | `'small' \| 'medium' \| 'large'`                                              | `'medium'`  | Size variant            |
| `external`  | `boolean`                                                                     | `false`     | External link indicator |
| `startIcon` | `ReactNode`                                                                   | -           | Icon before content     |
| `endIcon`   | `ReactNode`                                                                   | -           | Icon after content      |
| `href`      | `string`                                                                      | -           | Link URL                |
| `target`    | `string`                                                                      | -           | Link target attribute   |
| `rel`       | `string`                                                                      | -           | Link rel attribute      |

Also supports all standard HTML `anchor` attributes (e.g., `className`, `id`, `aria-*`, `data-*`).

### Variant Details

- **default**: Standard link styling with subtle color and no underline
- **underline**: Classic underlined link for maximum affordance
- **button**: Button-like appearance, useful for prominent call-to-action links

### Color Details

Each color maps to semantic design tokens:

- **primary**: Main brand color, use for primary navigation
- **secondary**: Neutral alternative, use for less prominent links
- **success**: Positive actions (e.g., "View results", "Success")
- **warning**: Cautionary links (e.g., "Review before continuing")
- **danger**: Destructive or critical links (e.g., "Delete account")
- **inherit**: Inherits color from parent, useful for text-matching links

### Size Details

- **small**: Compact size for dense interfaces or inline text (14px)
- **medium**: Default size for most use cases (16px)
- **large**: Prominent size for hero sections or headers (18px)

### External Link Handling

When `external={true}`:

- Automatically sets `target="_blank"`
- Adds `rel="noopener noreferrer"` for security
- Displays "↗" indicator (unless `endIcon` is provided)
- Includes accessible label "(opens in new tab)"

## Best Practices

### Do ✅

- Use `Link` for navigation (use `Button` for actions)
- Use `external` for outbound links to ensure safe `rel` + `target`
- Keep link text descriptive and scannable

### Don't ❌

- Don’t nest links inside links
- Don’t use `variant="button"` for destructive actions without an appropriate `color`

## Accessibility

The Link component follows WCAG 2.1 AA guidelines:

### Keyboard Navigation

- **Tab**: Navigate to link
- **Enter**: Activate link
- **Shift+Tab**: Navigate backward

All links are keyboard accessible by default with visible focus indicators.

### Screen Reader Support

**For Text Links:**

```tsx
<Link href="/about">About Us</Link>
// Screen reader announces: "About Us, link"
```

**For External Links:**

```tsx
<Link href="https://example.com" external>
  Documentation
</Link>
// Screen reader announces: "Documentation, link, (opens in new tab)"
```

**For Links with Icons:**

```tsx
<Link href="/settings" startIcon={<SettingsIcon />}>
  Settings
</Link>
// Screen reader announces: "Settings, link"
// (Icon is decorative, not announced)
```

### Best Practices for Accessibility

#### Do ✅

- Use descriptive link text that makes sense out of context
- Indicate when links open in new windows (handled automatically with `external`)
- Ensure sufficient color contrast (all variants meet WCAG AA)
- Keep focus indicators visible (default focus ring)
- Use underline variant when link affordance isn't clear

#### Don't ❌

- Don't use "click here" or "read more" without context
- Don't remove focus outlines (breaks keyboard navigation)
- Don't use only color to distinguish links (use underline/icons)
- Don't nest interactive elements inside links

### ARIA Attributes

The component handles external links automatically. Additional ARIA attributes can be passed:

```tsx
<Link href="/important" aria-label="Important announcement details" aria-describedby="announcement-summary">
  Read more
</Link>
```

### Color Contrast

All link variants meet WCAG 2.1 AA contrast requirements:

- Normal text: Minimum 4.5:1 contrast ratio
- Large text: Minimum 3:1 contrast ratio
- Interactive elements: Minimum 3:1 contrast ratio

Tested in both light and dark modes.

## Common Patterns

### Inline Text Links

```tsx title="src/components/Article.tsx"
import { Link } from '@grasdouble/lufa_design-system';

function Article() {
  return (
    <p>
      For more information, visit our{' '}
      <Link href="/docs" variant="underline">
        documentation
      </Link>{' '}
      or{' '}
      <Link href="/support" variant="underline">
        contact support
      </Link>
      .
    </p>
  );
}
```

### Navigation Menu

```tsx title="src/components/Navigation.tsx"
import { Link } from '@grasdouble/lufa_design-system';

function Navigation() {
  return (
    <nav>
      <Link href="/">Home</Link>
      <Link href="/about">About</Link>
      <Link href="/services">Services</Link>
      <Link href="/contact">Contact</Link>
    </nav>
  );
}
```

### Button-Style Links

```tsx title="src/components/CallToAction.tsx"
import { Link } from '@grasdouble/lufa_design-system';

function CallToAction() {
  return (
    <div>
      <Link href="/signup" variant="button" size="large">
        Get Started
      </Link>
      <Link href="/learn-more" variant="button" color="secondary">
        Learn More
      </Link>
    </div>
  );
}
```

### External Links with Icons

```tsx title="src/components/Resources.tsx"
import { Link } from '@grasdouble/lufa_design-system';

import { GithubIcon, TwitterIcon } from './icons';

function Resources() {
  return (
    <div>
      <Link href="https://github.com/example" external startIcon={<GithubIcon />}>
        View on GitHub
      </Link>
      <Link href="https://twitter.com/example" external startIcon={<TwitterIcon />}>
        Follow on Twitter
      </Link>
    </div>
  );
}
```

## Related Components

- **Anchor** - For in-page navigation using anchor links
- **Button** - For actions instead of navigation
- **Breadcrumb** - For hierarchical navigation
- **Menu** - For dropdown navigation menus

## TypeScript Support

The Link component is fully typed with TypeScript:

```tsx
import type { AnchorHTMLAttributes, ReactNode } from 'react';

interface LinkProps extends AnchorHTMLAttributes<HTMLAnchorElement> {
  children?: ReactNode;
  variant?: 'default' | 'underline' | 'button';
  color?: 'primary' | 'secondary' | 'success' | 'warning' | 'danger' | 'inherit';
  size?: 'small' | 'medium' | 'large';
  startIcon?: ReactNode;
  endIcon?: ReactNode;
  external?: boolean;
}
```

This ensures type safety and autocomplete in your IDE.
